segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and she looks so calm and happy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing or the children behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s enjoying her little moment of peace, even if it’s about to be ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies, and the stool is so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, looking so excited for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will turn around and catch them in the act.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, but she’s just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she stays happy, even if everything else is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing so precariously, but the girl doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this moment is going to end badly, but at least the woman is happy right now.
segments.speaker: PAR
